I am a 3rd year PhD Candidate at [Weill Cornell Medicine](https://www.weill.cornell.edu/) in the [Physiology, Biophysics, and Systems Biology program](https://gradschool.weill.cornell.edu/programs/pbsb), working with [Dr. Ed Reznik](https://www.mskcc.org/research-areas/labs/ed-reznik) at the [Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center](https://www.mskcc.org/).

My research focuses on the relationship between obesity and cancer. More specifically, I use computational methods to understand how obesity influences the molecular biology of tumours and determining the likelihood that these differences may be related to how obesity is a major cancer risk factor.

Previously, I completed my undergraduate degree in Microbiology and Immunology at [UBC](https://mbim.ubc.ca/) and worked as a research assistant in [Dr. Christian Steidlâ€™s lab](https://www.bccrc.ca/dept/lcr/people/christian-steidl) at the British Columbia Cancer Research Centre developing prognostic models and studying Follicular Lymphoma cancer evolution.
